task.Question: Each cell in the attached spreadsheet represents a plot of land. The color of the cell indicates who owns that plot. Green cells are plots owned by Earl Smith. Can Earl walk through every plot he owns (and no other plots) and return to his starting plot without backtracking? For this question, consider backtracking to be any instance where Earl would enter a plot of land he had already entered since leaving his starting plot.

Annotator Metadata.Steps:
1. Open the spreadsheet
2. Analyze the green cells.
3. Note that the shape of Earl’s plots is not a loop. There are dead-ends that can’t be traversed without doubling back to a previously-traversed cell.

steps.content:
Each cell in the attached spreadsheet represents a plot of land. The color of the cell indicates who owns that plot. Green cells are plots owned by Earl Smith. Can Earl walk through every plot he owns (and no other plots) and return to his starting plot without backtracking? For this question, consider backtracking to be any instance where Earl would enter a plot of land he had already entered since leaving his starting plot.

XLSX document content:
## Sheet1
|
|  |

Path to the mentioned document: /tmp/5cfb274c-0207-4aa7-9575-6ac0bd95d9b2.xlsx

plan: Open the provided XLSX document to access the spreadsheet data.
Identify and extract the cells that are colored green, which represent the plots owned by Earl Smith.
Create a graph representation of the green cells, where each cell is a node and edges represent possible paths between adjacent green cells.
Check if there is a Hamiltonian circuit in the graph, which would allow Earl to walk through every plot he owns and return to the starting plot without backtracking.
If a Hamiltonian circuit exists, conclude that Earl can walk through all his plots as described; if not, conclude that he cannot.

given_facts: Each cell in the spreadsheet represents a plot of land.
Green cells indicate plots owned by Earl Smith.
Earl needs to walk through every plot he owns and return to his starting plot without backtracking.
facts_to_lookup: The contents of the provided XLSX document to identify green cells.
facts_to_derive: Determine if a Hamiltonian circuit exists in the graph representation of the green cells.

steps.fact_description: Identify the green cells representing plots owned by Earl Smith.
Identify the green cells representing plots owned by Earl Smith.
steps.where_to_look_next: There are no green cells in the document.

steps.overview: Earl Smith has no plots of land represented in the spreadsheet.
